analysisConclusion: The table below shows the OpenInsight-Index rankings for GitHub activity and influence up to end of November 2021. Positions are compared to the rankings at the end of October. As for activity The top 4 leading organizations remain consistent this month with QingCloud progressing well above their closest neighbour’s growth figures，Contrastingly Alibaba, JD and Bytedance also see a decline in their activity this month. As for influence...
introduction: Welcome to OpenInsight-Index, where Chinese companies, projects and robot accounts are ranked by the activity and influence on GitHub.
openinsight: OpenInsight is a complete set of tools integrating open source data collection, open source data development and open source data visualization. It can solve the open source data analysis and reporting in a one-stop way. It has a professional and in-depth understanding of various indicators of various open source projects to help the community operate reasonably.
opendigger: OpenDigger is an open source analysis report project for all open source data initiated by X-lab, this project aims to combine the wisdom of global developers to jointly analyze and insight into open source related data to help everyone better understand and participate in open source.

Question.Q1: Your business or project is not here, and how to add it?
Question.Q2: The items that have been fed back are not seen in the ranking.

Answer.A1: Please submit feedback to GitHub warehouse: https://github.com/X-lab2017/open-digger Description of feedback method: (link to contribution process document) Open the submit modification template, fill in the project name, path, country and other information, and submit to issue. For template, please refer to: (issue template link)
Answer.A2: We have limited the number of projects. You can try to search for the name of your project in the search box at the top of the ranking to locate your item.
Answer.A3: X-lab is an open group for open-source research and innovation, connected by experts, scholars and engineers from universities, startups, and IT companies at home and abroad. Professional backgrounds include software engineering, data science, business administration, economics and other interdisciplinary fields. It performs long-term thinking and practice of open source strategy, open source measurement, open source digital ecosystems and other topics, and has also made influential work in areas including open source governance standards development, community behavioral metrics and analysis, and data governance.

Glossary.activity: Activity is an algorithm based on the analysis method of historical behavior log data, which counts the behavior of all warehouses and developers of GitHub in the whole domain, and weights the behavior data of GitHub. The specific calculation method is: ad = ∑ wiciad = ∑ wici, where ADAD is the developer activity, and CICI is the occurrence times of the above five behavior events triggered by the developer, Wiwi is the weighted proportion of the behavior event. According to a simple value evaluation, we can set this value to 1 - 5, that is, 1 point for issue comment, 2 points for issue, 3 points for PR, 4 points for code review comment on PR, and 5 points for pr. After the activity of each developer is calculated, the activity of the project can be calculated by a weighted sum method. The previously given method is: ar = ∑ ad − − √ ar = ∑ ad, that is, the activity of the project is the sum of the activity of all developers. Here, the square is to reduce the impact of the excessive activity of core developers. (project activity only considers the behavior data of developers in the current project.) for more information about activity, please check
Glossary.influence: On the basis of activity, a new upper layer algorithm is designed, which is a project influence evaluation method based on the global developer cooperation network. While evaluating the cooperation influence of all projects at one time, it can also deeply explore the cooperation relevance of the project and automatically judge the category of the project, So as to obtain the network cooperation influence of projects and individuals. For more information about OpenRank, please see
Glossary.activity_blog: How to evaluate an open source project (I) - activity blog.
Glossary.influence_blog: How to evaluate an open source project (2) - influence blog.

boardtitle.OSSSupplyChainEcoBoard: Open Source Software Ecosystem Supply Chain Dashboard
boardtitle.OSTechnologyAndLanguageBoard: Dashboard for OS Technology and Programming Languages
boardtitle.OSDbDomainInsightBoard: Dashboard for Insights into Open Source Database Field
boardtitle.GlobalBusinessOSInsightBoard: Global Business Open Source Insights Dashboard
boardtitle.MuLanOSCommunityInsightBoard: Mulan Open Source Community Insights Dashboard

boardcontent.GitHubGlobalIncreaseBoard: GitHub Global Increase Dashboard focuses on global GitHub data and presents the current state and trends of open source from various perspectives. Metrics include the OpenRank change trends of the top 10 developers and repositories, as well as the developers and projects with the highest OpenRank, providing a visual representation of their influence. The dashboard showcases the total number of global logs, active repositories, active developers, and programming language trends from 2015 to the present from a macro perspective, and developer activity periods, developer and robot behavior distribution, and other metrics from a micro perspective.
boardcontent.OSSSupplyChainEcoBoard: Open Source Software Ecosystem Supply Chain Dashboard helps companies understand the overall status of their software supply chain, identify potential issues and trends in their industry or field, and provide comprehensive reference and decision-making support. At the same time, companies can customize and filter the types of data and metrics they are interested in based on their own business needs to better understand and evaluate their software supply chain.
boardcontent.OSTechnologyAndLanguageBoard: Dashboard for Open Source Technology and Programming Languages presents the development trends of various technology fields and the future direction of programming languages: Firstly, in terms of technology fields, it displays the analysis results of various fields in terms of OpenRank and activity indicators, as well as the proportion of the number of projects, activity, and OpenRank indicators in each field. Secondly, in terms of programming languages, it shows the programming language change trends, global developer rankings, and programming language growth rate comparisons. From this, one can see the overall growth trends and popularity of various programming languages, providing a reference for developers in choosing programming languages.
boardcontent.OSDbDomainInsightBoard: Dashboard for Insights into Open Source Database Field mainly presents the overall development trends of various sub-domains in the database field and the development trends of various database projects. It not only provides an analysis of the sub-domains of databases in terms of OpenRank and activity indicators from a macro perspective, but also presents the analysis results of specific database projects from a micro perspective. It also includes the proportion of database development languages and License projects. From this dashboard, one can see the general direction of the future development of databases, providing some basis for selecting database technology and programming languages.
boardcontent.GlobalBusinessOSInsightBoard: Global Business Open Source Insights Dashboard presents changes in investment stages, amounts, and number of investments made by companies and organizations over different time periods, providing decision support. The dashboard includes two indicators, investment amount and number of investments, and can be customized based on business needs to better understand the commercial investment ecosystem. Through visualization, the dashboard presents investment situations, helps identify issues, formulates scientific investment strategies, and achieves better returns.
boardcontent.MuLanOSCommunityInsightBoard: Mulan Open Source Community Insights Dashboard aims to help open source community managers better understand and manage all open source organizations and projects within the community. It not only provides statistical indicators such as total number of organizations, total number of projects, merged PRs, and number of contributors, but also includes more complex indicators such as project activity and influence. It also includes monitoring and analysis of multiple aspects such as issues, PRs, and licenses, providing convenience for the management and development of open source projects.
boardcontent.OSProjectInsightBoard: Open Source Project Insights Dashboard includes indicators such as impact, attention, activity, bus factor, number of contributors, total Star/Fork count, and Star/Fork growth. Firstly, it provides an intuitive understanding of the overall situation of the project, such as quality, progress, and issues, helping the community to discover and solve problems in a timely manner. Secondly, attention and activity can motivate community members to participate in project development and maintenance, thus promoting community involvement and contribution. Finally, project data and indicator monitoring can improve project quality and transparency, promoting project development and promotion.
boardcontent.DeveloperContributionBoard: Dashboard for Developer Personal Contributions focuses on the collaborative and social behaviors of developers on GitHub, displaying a complete user profile of developers on GitHub through visualization. With the Developer Contribution Dashboard, users can quickly and deeply understand developers' past actions and have a more comprehensive understanding of developers from their perspective.
